page.title: 15A PET LAMB IN DEFYNNOG
page.content: Our farm keeps about fifty cows and about four hundred sheep. I would like a horse (maybe when I'm older) and mum would like some goats, but we do have 3 dogs and a tabby cat. Today we were pitching & earmarking, castrating and scarrifying. Me and my brother and grampa were the catchers, mummy earmarked and granny pitched. Today we did the Sufolks & the Jacobs. We started after dinner and finished at tea time. Then we went around the sheep that had still not lambed. Daddy spotted one of the mules which was lambing. He went over and pulled the lamb which had stopped breathing. It later died. We tried to surrogate a Sufolk lamb with a mule mother but she rejected it. So we had a pet lamb. At 6 we took the lambs to the flat field in Dan-y-cefn. Then went home for tea. (Julie Davies)
